intro: Primula viola-grandis, commonly known as the large viola primrose, is a species of flowering plant in the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters and prefers moist, well-drained soil in partial shade. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers are borne on long, slender stems and are known for their delicate appearance and fragrance.
